column4: how do i configure a new service to start at boot and stop at shutdown etc? this is sickbeard, couchpotato, tvheadend etc… they come with an init script that i copied to /etc/init.d and that works manually but it doesnt start on boot
caseymcg:
I dunno about upstart, but you can put symlinks for them into /etc/rc2.d/ to start and /etc/rc6.d/ to stop them
is there a helper tool to create the relevant rc?.d symlinks etc?
rcconf and update-rc.d mainly. check if you can install rcconf
looking at another service that was installed from a package (sabnzbd) it has symlinks in rc0.d, rc1.d and rc6.d
and enabled it at what point in the boot process? e.g. in the linkname "S??tvheadend" what number is "??" ?
20 for both dvbhdhomerun-utils and tvheadend
and the one you want to start later needs a higher number than the other
what update-rc.d command do i use for that? is it wrong to use update-rc.d servicename defaults to auto start services like this?
man update-rc.d  see the line "update-rc.d [-n] name defaults [NN | SS KK]"  it should be self explanatory what to use there
thanks
i changed dvbhdhomerun to start at 10, sickbeard and couchpotato at 20, and tvheadend at 30… but dvbhdhomerun is still not ready by the time tvheadend starts? are the services started sequentially?
that's a bad idea
whats a bad idea?
starting anything at 10
why? sabnzbd starts at K02 which is setup by the package installer… and the others that i setup are K10 K20 K30 … vmware tools is K38 … ?
K02 doesn't start anything, it "K" stops things
sorry i must have been looking in the wrong runlevel folder
personally I would use S40 S41 S42... if I were you. but your choice
i will change it… but still… hdhomerun doesnt seem to be ready by the time that tvheadend starts?
normally it is started sequentially. if it doesn't work like you want, I suggest you write some upstart jobs for it
